result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (1st) and Operating w/ PAC >=0.15 (1st). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (1st) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC >=0.15 (1st) was dismissed by the court.

  • Brett A Morneau was found guilty of OWI (1st). This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

$500.00 cash bond to be applied to restitution in Case No. 14CF291.
In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

Cash bond is to be applied to Restitution owed in case number 14CF291. 
In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Defendant Brett A Morneau in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF291 & 14CF317

14CF291 Arraignment - Information reading waived. Defendant pleads not guilty to count 1.

14CF317 Plea Hearing reset.

Both files reset to 12/08/2014 and bond continues on both files.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must abide by curfew of 10:00 PM to 6:00 AM.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
